Yes, you can continue the approach and land.
Yes, but only if you can see the runway threshold lights when passing 100'.

Continue because it only needs one pilot to be qualified
Can’t do it because the pilot qualified for LVO is not IFR qualified
Must wait for 300m RVR before take-off

The operator shall only conduct the following low visibility operations (LVO) when approved by the competent authority: - Low visibility take-off (LVTO) operation - Lower than standard category I (LTS CAT I) operation - Standard category I (CAT I) - Standard category II (CAT II) - Standard category III (CAT III) - Approach operation utilising enhanced vision systems (EVS) - Other than standard category III (OTS CAT III) operation;
What is a low visibility take-off?

options.text: A take-off on a runway where the RVR is less than 400 m.
A take-off on a runway where the RVR is less than 125 m.
A take-off on a runway where the RVR is less than 50 m.
A take-off on a runway where the RVR is less than 200 m.

The braking action for the destination runways are as below, can the pilot land at the destination?RWY 03L - 2100 m (POOR/MEDIUM/MEDIUM) 
 RWY 21R - 2100 m (MEDIUM/MEDIUM/POOR)

options.text: YES, RWY 21R, as there is enough space to land before poor braking action.

A crew are on a quick turnaround at Oslo, Gardermoen, Norway. The outside air temperature is -6° C and there is light snow falling. They receive a message from their company Operations Department requesting them to get airborne without delay. What should the Commander consider?

options.text: The prevailing weather conditions are such that the aircraft must be de-iced and anti-iced before take-off, even if this results in a delay.
The Commander may decide NOT to de-ice / anti-ice the aircraft in order to get airborne within the shortest amount of time.
The Commander should check the cost and time it takes to de-ice and anti-ice the aircraft and then decide if the contamination is enough to warrant de-icing / anti-icing.
In order to expedite the taxi and the take-off the Commander could ask that only the main wings are de-iced.

options.text: provided the aircraft is clear of ice and other contaminants that might adversely affect the performance or controllability of the aircraft.
provided the wings have 5 mm of ice or other contaminants that must be taken into account when calculating the take-off performance.
